title: Sum-free set
summary: In additive combinatorics and number theory, a subset A of an abelian group G is said to be sum-free if the sumset A + A is disjoint from A. In other words, A is sum-free if the equation a + b = c {\displaystyle a+b=c} has no solution with a , b , c âˆˆ A {\displaystyle a,b,c\in A} .
